intro: Eremolaena, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. It is native to southern Africa and includes several species, such as Eremolaena tenuifolia. The plants are shrubs or small trees with pinnate leaves and small, fragrant flowers. They are known for their milky sap, which is used in traditional medicine. Eremolaena species are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making them resilient to drought conditions.
